member.remarks: Version number as described in http://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/versioning When using pre-release (alpha, beta, rc...etc.) and because the order of the release is in alphabetical order, please use a double digit like alpha00 alpha01...etc. in order to make sure that we will follow the correct order for the versions.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.AudioEmitterComponent
member.summary: Component representing an audio emitter.

remarks.para: Associate this component to an entity to simulate a 3D localized source of sound coming from the entity center. Use the component and properties to attenuate or exaggerate the effect the distance sound attenuation and Doppler effect.

Several sounds can be associated to a single AudioEmitterComponent. Use the functions and to associate or dissociate a to the emitter component. Each Sound associated to the emitter component can be controlled (played, paused, stopped, ...) independently for the others. Once attached to the emitter component, a Sound is controlled using a . To get the AudioEmitterSoundController associated to a Sound use the function.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.AudioListenerComponent
member.summary: Component representing an audio listener.

remarks.para: Associate this component to an to simulate a physical listener listening to the s of the scene, placed at the entity's center and oriented along the entity's Oz (forward) and Oy (up) vectors.
Use the AudioSytem's and functions to activate/deactivate the listeners that are actually listening at a given time.
The entity needs to be added to the Entity System so that the associated AudioListenerComponent can be processed.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehBlur
member.summary: This class represents a blur to apply to a texture to create a bokeh effect. It's not supposed to be used as-is, rather you should use subclasses like , or ... which do actually implement a blur technique leading to a particular bokeh shape (circular, hexagonal).

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehBlur.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehBlur.SetColorDepthInput(SiliconStudio.Xenko.Graphics.Texture,SiliconStudio.Xenko.Graphics.Texture)
member.summary: Provides a color buffer and a depth buffer to apply the blur to.
member.param: The depth buffer corresponding to the color buffer provided.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehBlur.Radius
member.summary: Sets the radius of the blur. A child class can override it to do special processing when a new value is provided.
member.param: The new value of the blur.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique
member.summary: Techniques available to perform a DoF effect on a level. The technique directly affects the visual result (bokeh shape) as well as the performance.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique.CircularGaussian
member.summary: Circular blur using a Gaussian.
member.remarks: Fast and cheap technique but the final bokeh shapes are not very realistic.
member.userdoc: Use circular Gaussian blur to render the bokehs. This technique produce circular bokehs. It is fast and cheap technique but not very realistic.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique.HexagonalMcIntosh
member.summary: Hexagonal blur using the McIntosh technique.
member.userdoc: Use the McIntosh hexagonal blur to render the bokehs. This technique produce hexagonal bokehs

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique.HexagonalTripleRhombi
member.summary: Hexagonal blur using a combination of 3 rhombi blurs.
member.userdoc: Use a combination of 3 rhombi blurs to render the bokehs. This technique produce hexagonal bokehs

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechniqueExtensions.ToBlurInstance(SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.BokehTechnique)
member.summary: Instantiates a new from a technique name.
member.returns: A Bokeh blur corresponding to the tehcnique specified.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.GaussianBokeh
member.summary: Applies a depth-aware gaussian blur to a texture.
member.remarks: This does not produce beautiful bokeh shapes, but it is quite light-weight and performance-friendly.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.GaussianBokeh.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.McIntoshBokeh
member.summary: Applies a McIntosh blur to a texture. (Hexagonal bokeh)
member.remarks: This is a 3-pass (+1 final gathering) technique based on the paper of McIntosh from the Simon Fraser University. (2012) http://ivizlab.sfu.ca/papers/cgf2012.pdf

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.McIntoshBokeh.Phase
member.summary: Phase of the bokeh effect. (rotation angle in radian)

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.McIntoshBokeh.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.TripleRhombiBokeh
member.summary: Applies a TripleRhombi blur to a texture. (Hexagonal bokeh)
member.remarks: This is a technique based on DICE's presentation at Siggraph 2011. http://advances.realtimerendering.com/s2011/White,%20BarreBrisebois-%20Rendering%20in%20BF3%20%28Siggraph%202011%20Advances%20in%20Real-Time%20Rendering%20Course%29.pdf

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.TripleRhombiBokeh.Phase
member.summary: Phase of the bokeh effect. (rotation angle in radian)

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.TripleRhombiBokeh.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.CoCMapBlur
member.summary: Blurs a Circle of Confusion map.
member.remarks: This is useful to avoid strong CoC changes leading to out-of-focus silhouette outline appearing in front of another out-of-focus object. Internally it uses a special gaussian blur aware of the depth.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.CoCMapBlur.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.CoCMapBlur.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.CombineLevelsFromCoCKeys
member.summary: Keys used by the CombineLevelsFromCoCffect

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthAwareDirectionalBlurKeys
member.summary: Keys used by the DepthAwareDirectionalBlurEffect

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField
member.summary: Applies a depth-of-field effect to a scene. It takes as input a color-buffer where the scene was rendered, with its associated depth-buffer. You also need to provide the camera configuration you used when rendering the scene. You can optionally specify which bokeh technique should be used, the number of LOD levels with their Circle-of-Confusion strengths and their resolution.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.MaxBokehSize
member.summary: Maximum size of the bokeh (ie. when the circle of confusion is 1.0). This is resolution-independent, it is a ratio proportional to the screen width in percentage.
member.remarks: This property is not supposed to be modified at each frame since it generates garbage. Instead you should set it once for your scene and play with the DOF areas / lens parameters to make out-of-focus objects create bigger bokeh shapes.
member.userdoc: Specify the maximum size of the bokehs. This value is resolution-independent (proportional to the screen width in percentage).

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.DOFAreas
member.summary: Areas of the depth of field: [nearStart, nearEnd, farStart, farEnd] expressed as a distance from the camera.
member.userdoc: Specify the area focused by the depth of field (eg. the not blurred area). It is expressed as distances from the camera: [nearStart, nearEnd, farStart, farEnd].

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.QualityPreset
member.summary: Affects a preset quality setting, between 0 (lowest quality) and 1 (highest quality). This auto-configures and .
member.userdoc: The quality of the effect where 0 represents the worst quality and 1 the best one. Note that increase the quality of the effect significantly increase the rendering time.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.Technique
member.summary: Bokeh technique used to blur each level.
member.remarks: This influences the bokeh shape (circular, hexagonal...) as well as the performance.
member.userdoc: Specify the technique used to calculate the bokehs. This influences both the shape of the bokehs and the performances of the effect.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.AutoFocus
member.summary: Auto-focus on the pixel at the center of the screen.
member.userdoc: If checked, the depth of field area is automatically adjusted to the pixel at the center of the screen.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.LevelCoCValues
member.summary: The number of layers with their own CoC strength. Note that you need to define at least 1 level of blur, each level of blur should have a CoC stronger than its predecessor and the last level should always have a CoC of 1.0. Example: { 0.25f, 0.5f, 1.0f } The higher the number of levels is, the smoother the transition between 2 levels is, but at a performance cost.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.DepthOfField.LevelDownscaleFactors
member.summary: For each level defined in you can define a downscale factor (a power of 2) at which to operate. When not specified, the levels are treated by default at half the resolution of the original image. Example: for { 1, 2 }, the first level will be processed at half the original resolution, and the second level at 1/4. The array provided must be of the same size as the array.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Images.ImageMultiScaler
member.summary: Allow to up-scale or down-scale a texture (input) multiple times while capturing intermediate mipmap results (outputs).
member.remarks:
Based on the input texture and output texture, this class automatically downscale or upscale the input texture to the different output textures. The requirement for the output textures are:
They must have a mipsize compatible with input texture (multiple of 2).
They must share the same pixel format.
They must be a different size from input texture.
They must scale to a single direction (either down or up scale, but not both).

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes
member.summary: Common material attributes.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.Tessellation
member.summary: Gets or sets the tessellation.
member.userdoc: The tessellation method to use for this material. Tessellation consists into subdividing model poligons in order to increase the realism.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.Displacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the displacement.
member.userdoc: The displacement method to use for this material. Displacement consists into atering model original vertex position by adding some offsets.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.Surface
member.summary: Gets or sets the surface.
member.userdoc: The method to use to alter macro-surface aspect of this material. A classic example consists in perturbing the normals of the model.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.MicroSurface
member.summary: Gets or sets the micro surface.
member.userdoc: The method to use to alter micro-surface aspect of this material.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.Diffuse
member.summary: Gets or sets the diffuse.
member.userdoc: The method to use to determine the diffuse color of the material. The diffuse color of an object corresponds to the essential (pure) color of the object without any reflections.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.DiffuseModel
member.summary: Gets or sets the diffuse model.
member.userdoc: The shading model to use to render the material diffuse color.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.Specular
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular.
member.userdoc: The method to use to determine the specular color of the material. The specular color of an object corresponds to the color produced by the reflection of a white light on the object.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.SpecularModel
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular model.
member.userdoc: The shading model to use to render the material specular color.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.Occlusion
member.summary: Gets or sets the occlusion.
member.userdoc: The occlusion method to use for this material. Occlusions consists in modulating the ambient and direct lighting of the material to simulate shadows or cavity artifacts.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.Emissive
member.summary: Gets or sets the emissive.
member.userdoc: The method to use to determine the emissive color of the material. The emissive color of an object is the color emitted by the object.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.Transparency
member.summary: Gets or sets the transparency.
member.userdoc: The method to use to determine the transparency of the material.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.Overrides
member.summary: Gets or sets the overrides.
member.userdoc: Can be used to override some of the properties of the current material.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialAttributes.CullMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the cull mode used for the material.
member.userdoc: Specifies if some faces of the model should be culled depending on their orientation.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature
member.summary: An occlusion map for the occlusion material feature.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.AmbientOcclusionMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the occlusion map.
member.userdoc: The map specifying the ambient occlusion of the material. This modulates the amount of incoming ambient light to the material (0 => no ambient, 1 => full ambient). Ambient occlusions are generally used to produce coarse occlusions on the material (shadows, etc...). It is geometry related and thus ignores possible UV scale overrides.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.DirectLightingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets how much the occlusion map can influence direct lighting (default: 0).
member.userdoc: Specify how much the occlusion map should influence the direct lighting (non ambient lightings). Usually the occlusion maps are used only to affect ambient lighting, but using this parameter one can also have it partially affecting the direct lighting.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.CavityMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the cavity map.
member.userdoc: The map specifying the cavity occlusions of the material. This modulates the amount of incoming direct (non-ambient) light to the material (0 => no light, 1 => full light). Cavity occlusions are generally used to produce fine grained artifacts on the material.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.DiffuseCavity
member.summary: Gets or sets the diffuse cavity influence.
member.userdoc: Specify the influence of the cavity map on the diffuse lighting (0 => no influence, 1 => full influence).

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialOcclusionMapFeature.SpecularCavity
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular cavity.
member.userdoc: Specify the influence of the cavity map on the specular lighting (0 => no influence, 1 => full influence).

member.summary: A Specular map for the specular material feature.

member.summary: Gets or sets the specular map.
member.userdoc: The map specifying the color of the specular reflection.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularMapFeature.Intensity
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular intensity.
member.value: The map specifying the intensity of the specular reflection. An intensity of 0 means no reflection. An intensity of 1 means full reflection.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.Materials.MaterialSpecularMapFeature.IsEnergyConservative
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is energy conservative.
member.value: true if this instance is energy conservative; otherwise, false.
If checked, the material ensure the energy conservation between the diffuse and specular colors.

members.member:
Defines an effect permutation slot for a .
Each time an object is added to the render system, multiple effect instantiations might live concurrently. This define one such instantiation. To give a concrete example, a typical might define a slot for main effect, one for gbuffer effect and one for shadow mapping effect.

Represents a way to instantiate a given for rendering, esp. concerning effect selection and permutation.
Note that a stage doesn't imply any order. You can render any combination of and arbitrarily at any point of the Draw phase.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Extensions.SimpleExtensions.IsSimple(SiliconStudio.Xenko.Graphics.VertexBufferBinding)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified vertex buffer binding data is simple. A vertex buffer binding data is simple if: * Offset is 0. * Stride is 0 (automatic), or equals to Declaration.VertexStride. * Buffer.Content.Length is equal to Declaration.VertexStride * Count

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Extensions.SimpleExtensions.IsSimple(SiliconStudio.Xenko.Graphics.IndexBufferBinding)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified index buffer binding data is simple. A index buffer binding data is simple if: * Offset is 0. * Is32Bit is true. * Buffer.Content.Length is equal to sizeof(int) * Count.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Extensions.SimpleExtensions.IsSimple(SiliconStudio.Xenko.Rendering.MeshDraw)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified mesh draw data is simple. A is simple if: * It contains only one , which must be simple. * It contains either no , or a simple one. * StartLocation is 0. * DrawCount is IndexBuffer.Count if there is an index buffer, otherwise VertexBuffers[0].Count.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Audio.AudioEmitterSoundController
member.summary: This class is used to control a associated to a .

remarks.para: Instances of this class can not be directly created by the user, but need to queried from an instance using the function.

An instance is not valid anymore if any of those situations arrives:
The underlying is disposed.
The is detached from its entity.
The entity to which it is attached is removed from the Entity System.

member.summary: UnicastIPAddressInformation.IPv4Mask is not implemented in Xamarin. This method sits in a partial class definition on each native platform and retrieves the netmask in whatever way it can be done for each platform.

member.name: T:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient
member.summary: Sends and receives data over a TCP socket. Establish a connection with a listening TCP socket using ConnectAsync. Use the WriteStream and ReadStream properties for sending and receiving data respectively.

member.summary: Default constructor for TcpSocketClient.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Size of the buffer for the write stream.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.ConnectAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Establishes a TCP connection with the endpoint at the specified address/port pair.
member.param: The address of the endpoint to connect to.
The port of the endpoint to connect to.
True to enable TLS on the socket.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketClient.DisconnectAsync
member.summary: Disconnects from an endpoint previously connected to using ConnectAsync. Should not be called on a TcpSocketClient that is not already connected.

member.summary: A stream that can be used for receiving data from the remote endpoint.

member.summary: A stream that can be used for sending data to the remote endpoint.

member.summary: The port of the remote endpoint to which the TcpSocketClient is currently connected.

member.summary: Allows an object to try to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: T:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener
member.summary: Binds to a port and listens for TCP connections. Use StartListeningAsync to bind to a local port, then handle ConnectionReceived events as clients connect.

member.name: P:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener.ConnectionReceived
member.summary: Fired when a new TCP connection has been received. Use the SocketClient property of the TcpSocketListenerConnectEventArgs to get a TcpSocketClient representing the connection for sending and receiving data.

member.name: M:Sockets.Plugin.TcpSocketListener.StartListeningAsync(System.Int32,Sockets.Plugin.Abstractions.ICommsInterface)
member.summary: Binds the TcpSocketListener to the specified port on all endpoints and listens for TCP connections.
member.param: The CommsInterface to listen on. If unspecified, all interfaces will be bound.

member.summary: Stops the TcpSocketListener from listening for new TCP connections. This does not disconnect existing connections.
